detailsOfAchievement: Gramya Vikash Mancha(GVM) has been working with a vision to create a peaceful, prosperous, egalitarian and exploitation free society in every village.Mission of GVM is to empower the underprivileged section of society to take control over social institutions, thereby create a society, where these people can live with dignity. Main activities of the organisation are socio-economic empowerment , emergency relief and response, Disaster Management. The organisation has been working with active support of Actionaid India, IGSSS, SDTT, Jamsetji Tata Trust, National Council of Rural Institutes (NCRI), UNICEF, NEDFi etc in rural areas of Assam. The organisation has about 300 volunteers and 87 full time volunteers.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: The project is implemented in two blocks each of Nalbari and Baksa district of Assam, supported by Ministry of Rural Development, GOI covering 4000 women farmers. Primary objective of the project is to empower women through agriculture and allied activities. Under this project women farmers who are mainly involved in the household chores of the family are empowered to participate in economic decision making of the family, where economy of the family is mainly dependent on agricultural outputs. detailsOfAchievement: Respected Sir I, Akramul Hossain, Secretary of Helping Hands, am writing this letter on behalf of our organization that is working to promote socio-economic developments and to promote general education and computer education in Dhubri District of Assam, a state situated in North eastern part of India. Perhaps you are aware of the turmoil continuing in this part of the land due to ethnic clashes, insurgency and massive human right violation by state establishment. Apart from it, Dhubri also faces the wrath of natural disaster and calamity like flood every year. Dhubri is placed among the poorest districts in Assam in terms of infrastructure, transportation & communication, economy, development, health and literacy. Basically social structure reflects it as an agrarian society but now a days young generation has to come out for other professions for some of the reasons like the population pressure on the agricultural sector, rapid urbanization etc. We have experienced that in the absence of proper guidance and motivation to utilize the most fertile period of their life may lead to an apprehension that these frustrated unemployed youths may be misguided by the unsocial elements. Helping Hand provides support and motivates the young generation for some productive and professional courses. We have initiated some computer education programme, in free of cost for some of the students from rural community, which turns successful as some of our students able to obtain reputed positions in government as well as corporate sector. Some others utilized their computer education in business or other livelihood Now many youths, from rural community, minority community and even woman, are interested to join this computer education programme which is totally free of cost. But limited resources have tightened our hands. . We think you may extend your support to us as we have fulfilled the criterion of beneficiary organization as a non profit organization working in this field. Please find the attachment: Registration papers of Helping Hands and about the region where we are working. Thanking you Akramul Hossain (Secretary) Helping Hands

detailsOfAchievement: We are NGO with many welfare and medical camps conducted every year in Assam. We are running a biotechnology and cell culture lab at Guwhaati IIT Biotech park since 2012. We have collaborated with Stanford university in the past and have ongoing collaboration with Jawaharlal Nehru university in India. Scientifically we have a good team of students, doctors, Scientist and volunteers who actively participate in ongoing research work. The leading work of the Ngo is in identifying the stem cells that hide M.tuberculosis and can act as a relapse source for the disease. Our team has published three scientific papers mentioned below. 1) Preclinical and Clinical Evidence of Mycobacterium tuberculosis Persistence in the Hypoxic Niche of Bone Marrow Mesenchymal Stem Cells after Therapy. Garhyan J, Bhuyan S, Pulu I, Kalita D, Das B, Bhatnagar R. Am J Pathol. 2015 Jul;185(7):1924-34. PMID:26066709 2) Bone marrow mesenchymal stem cells provide an antibiotic-protective niche for persistent viable Mycobacterium tuberculosis that survive antibiotic treatment. Beamer G, Major S, Das B, Campos-Neto A. Am J Pathol. 2014 Dec;184(12):3170-5. PMID:25451154 3) CD271(+) bone marrow mesenchymal stem cells may provide a niche for dormant Mycobacterium tuberculosis. Das B, Kashino SS, Pulu I, Kalita D, Swami V, Yeger H, Felsher DW, Campos-Neto A. Sci Transl Med. 2013 Jan 30;5(170):170ra13. PMID:23363977

detailsOfAchievement: The activities Performed by Keshab Smarak Sanskriti Surabhi are as follows : The Samiti is Conducting regular Allopathic Medical Camps in different places of Barak Valley. Free medicines are also proving to the patients. A Mobile Medical Van is launched by the Samiti to bring doctors at the remote corner of the region and to cater the needs of the poor people for getting better health services. This Samiti celebrated Vishwa Yoga Divas with full zeal & enthusiasm. The two day Yoga Divas was inaugurated in G.C. College Auditorium, Silchar by the Honorable Governor of Assam, Shri P.B. Acharya on 20th June 2015. To eradicate Diabetes, a Programme was taken for 7 days in Silchar. Sri Sumanta Chandwarkar, a famous Yoga Teacher from Maharastra taught the technique of Yoga to the participants in the camp which started on 22nd June, 2015. About 200 members were present in the function & 61 No. of Patients attended the Camp To Provide medical assistance to the residents of remote areas, Keshab Smarak Sanskriti Surabhi had Launched Dhanwantari Seva Yatra Progamme in Barak Valley in the month of May 2015 & February 2016 respectively. A Joint programme of Seva Bharati Purbanchal & National Medical Organization, A total of 15 doctors of NMO came from across India to provide Medical Treatment to the Patients of Rural Area in Barak Valley & Mizoram. The No. of Camps were about 20 & Patients were about 4000. Besides giving Treatment, Medicines were distributed amongst the patients free of cost. 3 numbers of Computer Training centre are running by the samity at 3 differnt places. On 20th June 2015, the Honorable Governor of Assam Inaugurated Gramin Computer Training Centre under patronage of Surabhi. Training Centre for Sewing machine for ladies are running at 4 centres in Assam and Mizoram. House building materials and blankets as well as mosquito nets were provided to the victims of different natural calamities Surabhi Databbya Homoeo Treatment Centre is giving its service in Kalibari Char area of Silchar. Every Friday, Dr. Subhadip Kar renders free Service to the residents of that area through checkup & distributing Medicines free of cost. This Yojna is presently running in Assam, Tripura and Mizoram states in 754 centres running by 1384 Arogya Mitras. They are acting as rural health worker aiming to serve rural population. Surabhi Tabla School in running in Surabhi Karalaya under the Patronage of Surabhi Kalakendra. Every Sunday Sri Subhrajit Kar (Executive Member, K.S.S.S) imparts training to students free of cost. A Surabhi Yoga Center is successfully going on in Narshingpur at Cachar. Besides Yoga camps are organised at different locations of Assam and Tripura. On 21st Feb, 2016 a programme on Corneal Blindness Free India & Eye Donation was jointly organized by us & Barak Netradaan Sankalp Abhiyan Samiti under the initiative of SAKSHAM.

detailsOfAchievement: PLANTATION DRIVES

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Celebration of National Youth Day 2017 NYK, Haflong in collaboration with KOSHISH SOCIETY HAFLONG celebrated National Youth Day on 12-01-2017 at Shri Shri Jagannath Bari , Haflong from 5.30 pm onwards. KOSHISH SOCIETY also took part in the Rally event and Blood Donation Camp organised by Ram Krishna Mission Haflong on 12-01-2017 from 7.30 am to 12.30 pm.

Working towards this noble cause, NYK in collaboration with Koshish Society organised a Plantation Drive on 05-06- 2017, to sensitise students on the value of tree plantation. The saplings were procured from the Department of Forest, Haflong. We planted around 250 saplings in the school campus namely Govt Girls HS School, C.H.T Synod HS School, Lower Haflong High School, Saraswati Vidya Mandir with the support of the school authority and students.

title: LACHIT YUVAK SANGHA
detailsOfAchievement: Annual Report and Activities for the Year April 2015 to March 2016 The Lachit Yuvak sangha is a community based voluntary organisation, committed for rural community and youth. A young group of volunteer are rendering there service with dedication and philantopic mood for sustainable development looking the version. Unrelating endeavour and effort for the successful accomplishment of different porgramme and activities organised and implemented in the year 2014- 2015 in the various mention herewith. Health and Sanitation- Two nos of awareness generation programme on National Health mission were organized, collaboration with District programme Manager, Deptt. of H & F W govt. of Assam, Dhemaji, at Jayrampur Panchayat office and Hatigarh G.P. Co-operation with WHO Tezpur unit and health Deptt.of Dhemaji in the pulse polio immunization week drive. Total 60 nos of low cost sanitary latrine were constructed and handover to house hold family under SBM. Agriculture and Rural Development- Farming work through the 5 nos of SHGs have been doing in the Kochoiting, Hatigarh and Telijan Gaon. 5 nos of SHGs were brought to Bank credit linkage with SBI Dhemaji, among 50 nos of SHGs nursuring by Lachit Yuvak Sangha. Women Empowerment and Child Development- Total 4 nos of Rajib Gandhi National Creche programmes was implement, and 8 nos of workers income generate under CSWB, new Delhi. Formation and nurcsering SHGs amongst women in the ST area under NRLM. Co-operation in enrollment drive programme with Sarba Siksha Abhijyan Mission Dhemaji in the Dhemaji Dev. Block. Awareness programme on Right to information act. 2005 on 28th Sep. 2014 amongst the group of Youth and the News Paper correspondents and distributed copies of summary of the act. both English and Assamese version. detailsOfAchievement: Promoted one thousand Women Self Help Groups Promoted fifteen Nos of Farmers Club Promoted one hundred Joint Liability Groups Promoted Two numbers of Producer Groups Imparted training to one thousand women Self on livelihood sectors About five hundred Hectare of land has been brought under sustainable agricultural practices four hundred numbers of organic farmers created use of chemical pesticide and fertilizer reduced by fity to sixty percent

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Increasing productivity of paddy with sustainable agricultural practices . Five villages under Nalbari district was covered. The Project was started since 2011 and completed in the year 2015. Total about 1200 numbers of farmers with about 400 hectare of land.

Promotion of native variety of paddy with sustainable agricultural practices with special emphasis on increasing the income of the growers families. Fourty five villages under Nalbari disitrict was covered. Thirty seven numbers of native paddy identified in project vilalges. Documentation was done for 15 variety which are of important in view of seed sovereignty and climate change. Application submitted for GI registration of one native vaiety.Low cost seed bank have been established .

Training and demonstration was carried out for 200 numbers of farmers for adoption of SRI method in 200 Bigha of land. Improved variety of paddy introduced in the project location. Both inhouse and field training was given to the participating farmers. Close monitoring was done with the technical staff of the Lotus Progressive Centre. The productivity increased by 30-40 %.

Fourty five farmers were covered under the proeject. About 15 hectare of land was undertaken for cultivation of TS-36/38 variety of mustard . Standard package of practices developed by Assam Agricultural University was adopted by the participating farmers . Production increased 30-40%.

The objective of the project is to reduce the use of external inputs like chemical fertilizers and pesticides , hybrid. Use of native as well as high yielding crops with eco-friendly practices was adopted among the participating farmers.
Training was given to women SHG members on improved weaving technology , scientific rearing of livestock and poultry , group dynamics, record keeping
The purpose of the project is to organize sell cum exhibition outlet in local festival for direct interaction of producers and customers.
To popularize the SRI model among the farmers for increasing the productivity of paddy.
The purpose is to reduce external agricultural inputs and to promote eco-agriculture practices .
To digitize the information of SHGs and upload the information in Eshakti plateform launched by NABARD.
To promote farmers producer organization for collective production , processing ,grading and marketing of products for better income .
Collection and Analysis of sample for preparing Soil Health Card of farmers.
To facilitate women farmers through training ,demonstration and exposure for adopting sustainable agricultural practices.

detailsOfAchievement: Macbeth Drama took it inception in the year 1994 in consequence of an untiring endeavour of a few play lovers of Dhemaji both veteran and novice, having considerable experience in the concerned field of study and operation. It aims at enriching the Assamese culture through proper presentation, research and expansion of various ethnic group of Assam and has worked to his end since the very beginning. In particular it has continued its effort to bring modern drama to the common people by way of dramatic presentation of tribal folk traditions of a few linguistic communities such as the Misings, the Kacharies, the Deories as well as the Lalungs which are aboriginal sub-tribes of Assam. It has been holding Karmashalas and training programs and has tried to draw out pure connoisseurs of the respective area of learning. Till date Macbeth Drama has made the stage performance of more than sixty (60) dramas. Moreover it has made dramatic versions of one novel, three short stories and four folk tales and has staged them well. It has also made the necessary arrangements of for imparting short term training to twenty five trainees at National School of Drama, New Delhi and organized 45 days intensive theater workshop in auspice of National School of Drama, New Delhi an in collaboration with Jirsong Theater, Assam. A few of the notable plays that Macbeth Drama has staged successfully are Swapna Amaar Surujmukhi Phool, Chandita Gaadyat Epiyala Madya Athabaa Ati Padya Athaba Nabyadya, Nyay-Nishthaa (Assamese version of Les Justes of Albert Camus), Mrs. Adis, Jarou Rua Parja, Saat Saaudar Chenehi Bhani, Tejimala, Miri Jiyari, Labhita, Gaonloi Jaon, Kaanchamotir Bihad Gatha and Bhaal Paau Aakaahar Meghar Dhemali, Chandra Kanta, Joymoti. Moreover the group independently organized a theater festival in 2011.

detailsOfAchievement: Manab Sewa and Vikash Samittee was established in the year 1989. It has been registered under Societies Registration Act XXI of 1860 in the year 1993. Its aim is to create a society just by enabling the disadvantage group, to germinate love, fertility and fellow feeling among all the religion to work for the all round development of the society. The main motto of our organisation is Health Education Socio economic and Cultural Development of the Society. The organization has been working in different socio-economic development sectors in poor and backward areas of Assam. The organisation put more emphasis on three developmental sectors namely Education Health and Income Generation. It has been engaged in different awareness and motivational camps/campaigns in both rural and urban areas and organizing people for having benefits provided from different Govt NonGovt agencies. The organization believes that peace and prosperity can be established only through better organization of people in constructive line. Education Our organization have been running special schools for child labour under Ministry of Child Labour as well as running educational programme under SSA kamrup District. Several other vocational training like Cutting Knitting and Toy making and Toy making so that the beneficiaries can take up the trade to earn their livelihood. Lots of other Awareness Programmes like Mother Child health Awareness Women Right Awareness HIV Awareness have been conducted for making aware of the people of this region. As the inhabitants of these concerned areas are mostly backward. Sports we have been conducting several sports competitions to develop in this field for the young people of this region

sourceOfFunds.purpose: As we tried to use this programme as a tool for establishing peace and harmony among different social sections of the locality for creating a favourable environment-? To induce a sense of social harmony amongst youth of the region, and to involve them in nation building process, particularly economically and socially neglected or backward sections of the region, ? To provide positive stimulation and congenial environment for their all-round development etc.
